page.title: 01WOODS AND FARMS NEAR DEVORAN
page.content: The overall impression of this part of Cornwall is one of lush, green fields and woods. The tidal creek of Restronguet runs through the area and further away to the east joins the River Fal. Running alongside part of the creek lies the main A39 road which carries traffic from Truro to Falmouth and Lizard area. This traffic becomes very dense in the summer as it is a main holiday route. The branch railway line from Truro to falmouth runs north to south in the west of the area. In the north-east corner there is a private estate called Carclew which covers about 1.5 sq km. The whole of the area is sparcely populated. There are many farms; most are dairy farms with a little arable farming. Much of the land is covered with deciduous woods.
